active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between CRL (Certificate Revocation Lists) and OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol) for real-time S/MIME certificate revocation checking in high-security environments. Consider latency, privacy, and attack vectors like phishing or man-in-the-middle.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in S/MIME Certificate Management (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 001_Cryptography > 001_Cryptographic Protocols > 010_Secure Email Protocols > S/MIME > S/MIME Certificate Management). Use the provided learning objectives, active learning ideas, scaffolding layers (1-4), and flashcard schema to create optimized Anki-style flashcards. Incorporate university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy coverage, active recall via questions, scaffolding progression. Ground in research: PKI roles (CA/RA/Subscriber/Relying Party), lifecycle (issuance via CSR/RA validation, installation in Outlook, renewal, revocation via CRL/OCSP, key escrow), digital signatures (hash+private key encrypt), standards (CA/B Forum S/MIME BR), best practices (HSM, automation), comparisons (vs PGP), big picture (secure email vs phishing/MITM). Generate exactly 40 flashcards (10 per scaffolding layer). Use schema: JSON array of objects with 'front', 'back' (answer, explanation, distractors if MCQ, layer, related_objective), metadata. Balance: 30% REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, 30% APPLY/ANALYZE, 40% EVALUATE/CREATE. 20% MCQ with distractors per protocol. Questions active/precise. Explanations link to layers/objectives/sources. Output only valid JSON array.
